definition: A vast body of saltwater that covers a significant portion of the Earth's surface, typically used to refer to one of the five main divisions of the world's oceans. It is commonly employed in scientific, geographical, and general contexts to describe the immense bodies of water that separate continents and are home to diverse marine ecosystems.

examples.english: The children are playing at the ocean.

examples.german: Der Pazifische Ozean ist der größte Ozean der Welt.
examples.english: The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean in the world.
Many animals live in the ocean.
